episodeTitle: For His Friend! Bon Clay Goes to the Deadly Rescue!
description: After Luffy's devastating defeat by Magellan, he is thrown into a cell on Level 5 where he lies dying from massive poison absorption. Despite the hopeless situation and danger to himself, Bon Clay refuses to abandon his friend. He disguises himself as Hannyabal and drags Buggy and Mr. 3 to Level 5's Freezing Hell, where they battle Army Wolves in sub-zero temperatures to rescue the poisoned Luffy.

events.title: Luffy Thrown into Level 5 Cell
events.description: After his defeat by Magellan, Luffy is thrown unconscious into a cell on Level 5 of Impel Down. The guards expect him to die from the massive amount of poison in his body, leaving him to freeze in the Freezing Hell.
events.significance: This represents Luffy's lowest point in the Impel Down arc, seemingly defeated with no hope of recovery. It sets up the desperate rescue mission that will showcase Bon Clay's loyalty and introduce Emporio Ivankov's miracle healing.

quotes.text: Throw him in a cell on Level 5. He won't last long with that much poison in his system.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan ordering guards to dispose of the dying Luffy

events.title: Bon Clay's Declaration of Friendship
events.description: When Buggy questions why Bentham would risk his life to save Luffy, Bon Clay declares that Luffy is his friend and that's all the reason he needs. He refuses to abandon Luffy even though there appears to be no antidote to Magellan's poison.
events.significance: This moment defines Bon Clay's character and demonstrates the depth of friendship in One Piece. Despite having known Luffy for a relatively short time, Bon Clay is willing to sacrifice everything for his friend, embodying one of the series' core themes.

quotes.text: Because he's my friend! I don't need any other reason!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bon Clay's response to Buggy questioning his decision to rescue Luffy

events.title: Learning About the Miracle Worker 'Iva'
events.description: When Galdino mentions it would take a miracle to save Luffy, Bon Clay overhears guards discussing a prisoner called 'Iva' or 'Ivan-san,' known as a miracle worker who has been missing from Impel Down. The guards also mention the mysterious phenomenon of 'Demoning Away' - prisoners who disappear without a trace.
events.significance: This introduces the concept of Emporio Ivankov and Level 5.5 (Newkama Land) to the narrative. It gives Bon Clay a glimmer of hope and a goal for the rescue mission, setting up Ivankov's dramatic reveal in the next episode.

quotes.text: A miracle worker? Ivan-san? If there's even the slightest chance...
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bon Clay overhearing guards discuss the mysterious Ivankov

events.title: Bon Clay Transforms into Hannyabal
events.description: Bentham uses his Clone-Clone Fruit powers to transform into Vice Warden Hannyabal, using the authority of this position to access Level 5 and gather information about where Luffy was taken.
events.significance: This demonstrates Bon Clay's tactical use of his Devil Fruit abilities for infiltration. His transformation into Hannyabal allows him to move through Impel Down with authority, showing his cleverness in addition to his bravery.

events.title: Buggy and Mr. 3 Forced to Help
events.description: Despite their protests and fear, Buggy and Mr. 3 are dragged along by Bon Clay on the rescue mission to Level 5. They complain about the danger but ultimately follow, albeit reluctantly.
events.significance: This establishes the reluctant alliance between the three escapees. While Buggy and Mr. 3 lack Bon Clay's selfless motivation, they are pulled into the rescue attempt, setting up their continued involvement in the Impel Down escape.

quotes.text: Are you insane?! Level 5 is a frozen hell! We'll die!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy protesting Bon Clay's rescue plan

events.title: Arrival at Level 5 - Freezing Hell
events.description: Bon Clay, Buggy, and Mr. 3 arrive at the gates of Level 5, known as the Freezing Hell. The guards at the entrance explain that it's the exact opposite of Level 4's Burning Hell - a frozen wasteland where prisoners freeze to death. Army Wolves patrol the level, hunting any who try to escape.
events.significance: This introduces Level 5 as a major location in the Impel Down arc. The extreme cold and dangerous wolves create additional obstacles for the rescue mission, raising the stakes and demonstrating the prison's cruel design where prisoners suffer in alternating extreme temperatures.

quotes.text: This is Level 5, the Freezing Hell. Prisoners here either suffer a lifetime in severe cold or freeze to death.
quotes.speaker: Guard
quotes.context: Guard explaining Level 5 to the disguised Bon Clay

events.title: Battle with the Army Wolves
events.description: After Bon Clay reveals his true identity and breaks into Luffy's cell, the group is attacked by a pack of Army Wolves - ferocious creatures that hunt prisoners in Level 5. Bon Clay fights off the wolves using his ballet-based martial arts while trying to protect the unconscious Luffy.
events.significance: This battle showcases Bon Clay's combat abilities and determination even in the face of overwhelming odds and freezing temperatures. It demonstrates the additional dangers of Level 5 beyond just the cold, and shows Bon Clay's willingness to fight despite being injured and exhausted.

quotes.text: Get back! I won't let you touch Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bon Clay defending the unconscious Luffy from wolves

events.title: Bon Clay Pulls Luffy Through the Snow
events.description: Despite being wounded by the wolves and suffering in the extreme cold, Bon Clay places Luffy on a makeshift sled and pulls him through the frozen wasteland of Level 5. He continues forward even as he bleeds and weakens, refusing to give up on finding Ivankov.
events.significance: This is one of the most powerful demonstrations of friendship in the entire series. Bon Clay's physical suffering and determination to save Luffy, even when it seems hopeless, showcases the strength of their bond and Bon Clay's heroic nature.

quotes.text: Hang in there, Luffy! I have to keep going... even if there's only the slimmest chance...
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Bon Clay struggling to pull Luffy through the snow while wounded

events.title: Luffy's Unconscious Conqueror's Haki
events.description: When the Army Wolves attack again and one bites Bon Clay's leg, Luffy briefly regains consciousness. Even in his poisoned, dying state, Luffy instinctively protects his friend by releasing a burst of Conqueror's Haki, causing all the wolves to pass out instantly before Luffy collapses again.
events.significance: This is a crucial moment showing Luffy's Conqueror's Haki activating unconsciously to protect someone he cares about. It parallels his earlier use on Amazon Lily and demonstrates that even at death's door, Luffy's will to protect his friends remains strong. This foreshadows the importance of Haki in future arcs.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's barely conscious words before unleashing Conqueror's Haki

events.title: The Mysterious Figure Appears
events.description: As both Luffy and Bon Clay lie unconscious in the snow surrounded by knocked-out wolves, a mysterious figure appears above them. The figure is dressed in black and white with a distinctive lightning bolt scar, holding a glass of wine, observing the two collapsed bodies.
events.significance: This is the first visual appearance of Emporio Ivankov in the anime, though their identity isn't yet revealed. The dramatic cliffhanger sets up the next episode's introduction of Level 5.5 and Ivankov's miracle healing abilities, which will save Luffy's life.

quotes.text: Because he's my friend! I don't need any other reason!
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Declaring his motivation to rescue Luffy

quotes.text: Hang in there, Luffy! I have to keep going... even if there's only the slimmest chance...
quotes.speaker: Bentham
quotes.context: Pulling Luffy through the snow while wounded

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Barely conscious before unleashing Conqueror's Haki

themes.description: The episode powerfully demonstrates the strength of friendship through Bon Clay's willingness to sacrifice everything to save Luffy, despite having known him for a relatively short time. This loyalty transcends rational self-interest.
themes.symbolism: Bon Clay pulling Luffy through the frozen wasteland symbolizes the lengths true friends will go to for each other, even through the harshest conditions. The sled represents carrying a friend's burden when they cannot walk themselves.

themes.description: Even when everyone tells him it's hopeless and there's no antidote, Bon Clay refuses to give up. His determination to find even the slimmest chance of saving Luffy drives him forward through extreme pain and danger.
themes.symbolism: The freezing hell of Level 5 represents the overwhelming obstacles that can face someone pursuing a seemingly impossible goal, yet Bon Clay pushes through regardless.

themes.description: Even while dying from poison, Luffy's unconscious will manifests to protect Bon Clay from the wolves. This demonstrates that the desire to protect loved ones can transcend physical limitations.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's Conqueror's Haki activating while unconscious symbolizes how the will to protect others is so fundamental to his character that it operates even when he's not conscious.

characterSpotlights.development: This episode represents Bon Clay's finest moment, showcasing his evolution from a Baroque Works villain to one of Luffy's most loyal friends. His willingness to die for Luffy cements him as one of the most beloved characters in One Piece.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of Bon Clay pulling Luffy through the snow, adding more emotional weight and showing his suffering in greater detail than the manga.
The anime adds more dramatic tension to Luffy's Conqueror's Haki moment, with enhanced visual effects and longer reaction shots from Bon Clay.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts chapters 535-536 of the manga, focusing on the immediate aftermath of Luffy's defeat and Bon Clay's rescue attempt.
The episode's TV rating was 10.7%, ranking 4th in its time slot when it aired in Japan.
The eyecatcher (commercial break illustration) for this episode features Zoro and Chopper, despite neither character appearing in the episode.

This episode marks the second time in the anime that Luffy uses Conqueror's Haki, with the first being on Amazon Lily in episode 413. This instance is particularly notable as it occurs while Luffy is unconscious and dying.
Bon Clay's declaration 'Because he's my friend!' has become one of the most quoted and beloved lines in One Piece, frequently cited by fans as an example of the series' themes of friendship.
Level 5 prisoners shown in the background include Kairo Kureyo, Muchana, Sukoshiba Kanishitoru, and Kinoko - all minor characters who appear frozen in their cells.
